HEB 1.title: Elementary Hebrew
HEB 1.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has already been awarded.
HEB 1.description: The beginning course in Hebrew. Starting with the study of the alphabet, the student is initiated into the rudiments of the language. Basic grammar, vocabulary, and conversation.

HEB 2.title: Elementary Hebrew
HEB 2.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has already been awarded.

HEB 3.title: Elementary Hebrew
HEB 3.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has already been awarded.

HEB 4.title: Intermediate Modern Hebrew
HEB 4.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has already been awarded.
HEB 4.description: Continuation of Hebrew 3 with emphasis in writing, composition, and reading of Hebrew newspapers. Introduction to modern Hebrew literature: prose and poetry.

HEB 5.title: Intermediate Modern Hebrew
HEB 5.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has already been awarded.

HEB 6.title: Intermediate Modern Hebrew
HEB 6.comments: No credit can be earned if more advanced credit in the language has already been awarded.

HEB 114A.title: Readings in Modern Hebrew Prose and Poetry
HEB 114A.prereq_description: Hebrew 6 or fluency with departmental approval.
HEB 114A.description: Improve language ability and acquire knowledge in Hebrew literature. Readings/analyzing texts of modern and contemporary major Hebrew writers. Relationships between land, people and history, social, political, spiritual, and gender issues; impact of war.

HEB 114B.title: Readings in Modern Hebrew Prose and Poetry
HEB 114B.prereq_description: Hebrew 6 or fluency with departmental approval.
HEB 114B.description: Improve language ability and acquire knowledge in Hebrew literature. Readings/analyzing texts of modern and contemporary major Hebrew writers. Relationships between land, people and history, social, political, spiritual, and gender issues; impact of war.

HEB 114C.title: Readings in Modern Hebrew Prose and Poetry
HEB 114C.prereq_description: Hebrew 6 or fluency with departmental approval.
HEB 114C.description: Improve language ability and acquire knowledge in Hebrew literature. Readings/analyzing texts of modern and contemporary major Hebrew writers. Relationships between land, people and history, social, political, spiritual, and gender issues; impact of war.
